summary: “I know it’s hard. I miss her too but she’d want you to be happy. She knows how important your family is and why you retired in...
caption:
“I know it’s hard. I miss her too but she’d want you to be happy. She knows how important your family is and why you retired in the first place, you are honouring her memory in the best way by moving on. She sacrificed herself for us all to be happy and live our lives. Be happy and know she’s looking over you.” You comforted him.

Clint sighed, “What would I do without you.”

“I know I’m not Nat but you’re family and I’m always going to be here for you. I love you and you deserve to be happy.”

Requested By allisonbaelfire

summary: I may not have actively shipped Steve Rogers and Peggy Carter together, but I damn well respected both of them as individuals...
body:
I may not have actively shipped Steve Rogers and Peggy Carter together, but I damn well respected both of them as individuals and their potential together.


Endgame has forever soured their relationship to me. I can’t watch The First Avenger again in the same way, nor Winter Soldier or even Civil War. Their relationship now, in my eyes at least, will forever represent abandonment, selfishness and regression. Not because of Peggy, who was unfortunately reduced to a prize and deserved better. But because of Steve Rogers, who, frankly, has become that creepy guy mooning through the window who won’t leave a girl alone.

Also - do we really think that Peggy Carter, amazing woman and badass that she is, once she found out that Steve was from the future (because I mean, he’s coming back looking 10 years older) and discovered he left behind a world that needed someone to help them rebuild wouldn’t rage over him doing something so irrevocably irresponsible? Steve didn’t need to be Captain America to help the world rebuild, he could’ve retired and given the shield to Sam. He could’ve helped the world in a far different way - with less punching this time. With no fight. He was running support groups. He knows more than anyone what it’s like to have your world changed overnight. He could’ve helped rehabilitation efforts without holding the mantle of Captain America.

Peggy Carter would not have condoned his actions nor his attitude.

body: I would’ve enjoyed that

reblog.comment: I would’ve enjoyed that

trail.content_raw: I would’ve enjoyed that

body:
FANFICITON IDEA UP FOR ADOPTION

I had this fanfiction idea, but I really dont have the time to write it. So, here’s the idea and its up for adoption if anyone wants it…

  • Starts off by dealing with the consequences of Steve’s ending in Endgame - In my little universe, when Steve went back he DID create an alternate reality/timeline and the kids in CAWS aren’t his, because ew.
  • So, Steve goes back to Peggy and lives his life under the alias of Richard Barnes, so as not to create hysteria by the fact that Captain America is back from the dead and only like a select few people know who he really is.
  • Steve does go on missions and he does save Bucky and prevent hydra from infiltrating SHIELD etc. But when alternate Bucky finds out about how Steve left MCU Bucky he can’t forgive Steve, and the two fall out.
  • Steve and Peggy have kids and grandkids, but only ONE of them has the combination of genes that gives them superhuman powers… Rikki Barnes (Grandaughter of Peggy Carter and Richard Barnes in the comics). Steve teaches Rikki how to fight. The kids don’t know that Steve is from the MCU, they just know him as Richard Barnes who is a secret super soldier (or whatever).
  • So, when it gets to around the time frozen Steve is going to be discovered, MCU Steve says bye to Peggy and goes back to the MCU timeline to hand back the shield to Sam… But he doesn’t tell his kids and grandkids because they wouldn’t have let him go, and they think he’s past away
  • But when they go to defrost the Steve in that timeline… he doesn’t wake up. Tony said ‘You can only mess so much with time before it starts to mess with you back’. And MCU!Steve being in the wrong timeline for so long basically fucked everything up.
  • So when the battle of New York happens in 2012, everything is different. Steve isn’t there as captain America, Iron man never happened (because Steve would have made sure Howard raised his son right). So, Rikki fights with the remaining avegers who are still in that timeline, but of course they lose because they needed Tony and Steve to win.
  • In that reality they Earth is destroyed, but the tesseract (or a portal) opens up and that timelines Rikki falls from her world into the MCU timeline… which of course has her grandfather who she thinks is dead…. Thus she is the ‘girl without a world’ from the comics.

Now it goes to the MCU, with Sam and Bucky.

  • Sam and Bucky are dealing with there feelings about what Steve has done - Anger at leaving them. Bucky feels worthless (my precious child), Sam is unsure about taking over as Captain America
  • Because the government are gross, they dont exonerate Bucky just because he fought for them in Endgame. So they put him in a psychiatric facility, for rehabilitation.
  • Plus, the government aren’t just gonna be like ‘Oh yeah, Sams the knew Captain America because Steve said so’. So they create a new captain America who they see as the ‘ideal’ soldier, and Sam has to go on the run with the shield so he doesnt get arrested for what happened with the ACCORDS.
  • Sam breaks Bucky out of the psychiatric facility and they go undercover as spies, with the help of Nick Fury, Maria Hill and Sharon Carter (Who will be a badass woman, who is not reduced to be anyone’s lover). They go on missions to prove this new Captain America is evil, and also to investigate these portals from the multiverse which have been opening up.
  • INSERT BUDDY COP HUMOUR
  • Eventually, they are going to run into Rikki Barnes whose gonna be super confused about who they are and where she is. They battle and she recognises Bucky from a photo in Steve’s office from her world. And they take her to old!Steve who is out living the quiet life.
  • He is forced to tell her about how he left his world because he was so broken. She’s really pissed off because technically she shouldn’t have ever existed, plus she’s really started to become pals with Bucky and can’t understand why Steve could leave him.
  • Bucky always loved Steve, and Steve loved Bucky - but Steve thought they’d be toxic for each other if they ever got together because they were so broken.
  • Rikki tells Bucky what happened to her world, but she refuses to tell Steve because no matter how much she hates him, she knows it would kill him if he knew what he had caused.
  • There’s an epic final battle where Sam, Rikki and Bucky team up and share the shield to defeat the new Psycho cap
  • Everyone is so pleased that they exonerate Bucky and Sam is the New Captain America
  • Rikki decides to travel the multiverse under the alias of Nomad (from the comics) fighting crime. Steve asks her for a favour before she goes. He tells her about the timeline where Thanos doesnt exist, and asks her to travel there to make sure that that Steve saves Bucky. She says she will do it for Bucky but not for him and leaves.

I had ideas for a sequel too, might post it later. Maybe I’ll get round to writing this one day, but seriously doubt it :(

He tells her about the timeline where Thanos doesnt exist, and asks her to travel there to make sure that that Steve saves Bucky. She says she will do it for Bucky but not for him and leaves.

FANFICITON IDEA UP FOR ADOPTION

I had this fanfiction idea, but I really dont have the time to write it. So, here’s the idea and its up for adoption if anyone wants it…

  • Starts off by dealing with the consequences of Steve’s ending in Endgame - In my little universe, when Steve went back he DID create an alternate reality/timeline and the kids in CAWS aren’t his, because ew.
  • So, Steve goes back to Peggy and lives his life under the alias of Richard Barnes, so as not to create hysteria by the fact that Captain America is back from the dead and only like a select few people know who he really is.
  • Steve does go on missions and he does save Bucky and prevent hydra from infiltrating SHIELD etc. But when alternate Bucky finds out about how Steve left MCU Bucky he can’t forgive Steve, and the two fall out.
  • Steve and Peggy have kids and grandkids, but only ONE of them has the combination of genes that gives them superhuman powers… Rikki Barnes (Grandaughter of Peggy Carter and Richard Barnes in the comics). Steve teaches Rikki how to fight. The kids don’t know that Steve is from the MCU, they just know him as Richard Barnes who is a secret super soldier (or whatever).
  • So, when it gets to around the time frozen Steve is going to be discovered, MCU Steve says bye to Peggy and goes back to the MCU timeline to hand back the shield to Sam… But he doesn’t tell his kids and grandkids because they wouldn’t have let him go, and they think he’s past away
  • But when they go to defrost the Steve in that timeline… he doesn’t wake up. Tony said ‘You can only mess so much with time before it starts to mess with you back’. And MCU!Steve being in the wrong timeline for so long basically fucked everything up.
  • So when the battle of New York happens in 2012, everything is different. Steve isn’t there as captain America, Iron man never happened (because Steve would have made sure Howard raised his son right). So, Rikki fights with the remaining avegers who are still in that timeline, but of course they lose because they needed Tony and Steve to win.
  • In that reality they Earth is destroyed, but the tesseract (or a portal) opens up and that timelines Rikki falls from her world into the MCU timeline… which of course has her grandfather who she thinks is dead…. Thus she is the ‘girl without a world’ from the comics.

Now it goes to the MCU, with Sam and Bucky.

  • Sam and Bucky are dealing with there feelings about what Steve has done - Anger at leaving them. Bucky feels worthless (my precious child), Sam is unsure about taking over as Captain America
  • Because the government are gross, they dont exonerate Bucky just because he fought for them in Endgame. So they put him in a psychiatric facility, for rehabilitation.
  • Plus, the government aren’t just gonna be like ‘Oh yeah, Sams the knew Captain America because Steve said so’. So they create a new captain America who they see as the ‘ideal’ soldier, and Sam has to go on the run with the shield so he doesnt get arrested for what happened with the ACCORDS.
  • Sam breaks Bucky out of the psychiatric facility and they go undercover as spies, with the help of Nick Fury, Maria Hill and Sharon Carter (Who will be a badass woman, who is not reduced to be anyone’s lover). They go on missions to prove this new Captain America is evil, and also to investigate these portals from the multiverse which have been opening up.
  • INSERT BUDDY COP HUMOUR
  • Eventually, they are going to run into Rikki Barnes whose gonna be super confused about who they are and where she is. They battle and she recognises Bucky from a photo in Steve’s office from her world. And they take her to old!Steve who is out living the quiet life.
  • He is forced to tell her about how he left his world because he was so broken. She’s really pissed off because technically she shouldn’t have ever existed, plus she’s really started to become pals with Bucky and can’t understand why Steve could leave him.
  • Bucky always loved Steve, and Steve loved Bucky - but Steve thought they’d be toxic for each other if they ever got together because they were so broken.
  • Rikki tells Bucky what happened to her world, but she refuses to tell Steve because no matter how much she hates him, she knows it would kill him if he knew what he had caused.
  • There’s an epic final battle where Sam, Rikki and Bucky team up and share the shield to defeat the new Psycho cap
  • Everyone is so pleased that they exonerate Bucky and Sam is the New Captain America
  • Rikki decides to travel the multiverse under the alias of Nomad (from the comics) fighting crime. Steve asks her for a favour before she goes. He tells her about the timeline where Thanos doesnt exist, and asks her to travel there to make sure that that Steve saves Bucky. She says she will do it for Bucky but not for him and leaves.

I had ideas for a sequel too, might post it later. Maybe I’ll get round to writing this one day, but seriously doubt it :(

Y’all know the drill.

tags: this really sucks why are you reading this smh
body:
Is this seat taken?— p.p.

+Pairing : Peter Parker x Reader

+Warnings : None

+Summary : After an eventful morning, you are interrupted by another person while on the bus.

+Word Count : 554

A/N : Hey. First thing that I’m ever posting on this site & first Peter Parker thing. Hope the five people that see it, like it. I plan this to be a mini-series of some sort. It’ll be based on the song Gone Gone Gone by Phillip Phillips. Anyways, enough of my rambling and have good day/night! :)

——

First day of your Junior year was a mess so far. You woke up late, as in, really late. You rushed through your shower so quickly that you thought there was absolutely no difference between you before the “shower” versus you after it. You couldn’t find anything to wear for some reason. plus so much more. But hey, atleast I’m on the bus now.

You opened your bag to grab a book you were supposed to finish last night but you passed out, for good reason. You plugged your earphones in, already connected to your phone playing whatever. As you were reading, you began to look forward to the day. It couldn’t get worse than what happened. Who knows what’ll happen ne— “Hey, is this seat taken?”

Your thoughts were interrupted when someone asked you something but you didn’t really understand. You peeked your head out of your book and looked to your right to see another student, but one you haven’t met or recognized. Although, you gotta admit, he looks kinda cute. Actually, really cute. Hey! Focus Y/N.

“I’m sorry, uhm. Can you repeat?” You manage to say while removing your earphones. “Oh ok. Uhm. I asked if this seat was taken.” He said pointing to the empty space beside you. “Hmm… I guess it is now.” You say, chuckling after you do so. That was smooth. The chuckle was short lived however as he seemed to not understand. Nevermind. Nice try at being funny me. “I mean, no. It’s free.” You bluntly said. With that note, a small grin formed on his face as he moved to sit down next to you, mumbling a thanks.

You mentally adjust yourself to accommodate company. “Oh, I’m Peter.. Peter Parker.” He introduced as he put his hand out to shake yours. “Well, hi Peter. I’m Y/F/N Y/L/N.” You responded with glee as you shake his hand. “I don’t recognize you. Are you a new student?” You ask. “Yeah, actually. You have a nice eye.” “I mean, not necessarily but thanks.”

Oh dear. He’s a really attractive new student and I’m his first friend?¿ I’ve just struck gold.

—

You walk Peter to the cafeteria where you two buy your lunch and go to your table with Ned and MJ. “Hey guys. Sorry I wasn’t able to come here at recess. I gave this guy a tour of this trashy place.” You apologize to them as you and Peter sit down on the vacant seats. “I’m Peter, by the way.”

“Michelle, call me MJ. This is Ned.”

“So Peter, tell us more about yourself. Why’d you transfer? What’s your take on the school so far?” Ned asks.

“Well, I came from—”

“Sorry, but I have to go to the restroom real quick.” You interrupt him.

“Oh, me too. Just keep talking. We’ll catch up.” MJ says before the two of you walk to the restroom, leaving Peter and Ned.

“So… Peter, huh?”

“MJ, what does that mean?” As you two walk to the restroom, MJ brings up something she noticed. “I see the way you look at him.” “MJ, I have no idea what you’re getting at.” “Yeah, sure you don’t.”

While MJ was accusing you of having a thing for Peter, you couldn’t help but think. Maybe, I do have a thing for him. Maybe. Just maybe.

—

Notes : Eeeee. That’s that. If you liked it, thanks! Anyways, once again: Good day! :)
